intro: Hermione italica, commonly known as the Italian hermione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and aromatic foliage.
